actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 39 and title 18, United States Code, to provide for licensing and protection of distinctive designs, legends, and insignia of the U.S. Postal Service.

summary.text: Allows the Postal Service to establish and collect use or royalty fees for the manufacture, reproduction or use of any distinctive design, legend, or insignia originated under authority of and certified by the Postal Service for use in connection with the operation of the Postal Service. Provides for a fine of not more than $250 or imprisonment for not more than 6 months or both for unauthorized manufacture, reproduction or use of insignia. (Adds 39 U.S.C. 413; 18 U.S.C. 1738)

titles.title: A bill to amend title 39 and title 18, United States Code, to provide for licensing and protection of distinctive designs, legends, and insignia of the U.S. Postal Service.
